latest news.eng_title: Curbline Properties Publicly Files Form 10 with SEC By Investing.com
latest news.summary: SITE Centers Corp. (NYSE: SITC) announced that Curbline Properties Corp. (Curbline) has publicly filed a Registration Statement on Form 10 with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on September 3, 2024, as part of the company's plan to spin-off its convenience assets into a separate publicly traded company. The spin-off is subject to certain conditions, including the SEC declaring the Form 10 effective and approval by the SITE Centers Board of Directors. Curbline will become an independent, publicly traded company upon its spin-off from SITE Centers, expected to occur on October 1, 2024, and will trade under the ticker symbol CURB on the NYSE. SITE Centers considers certain information in this press release to be forward-looking statements, including the ability to complete the spin-off in a timely manner or at all, and the impact of the spin-off on the business of SITE Centers and Curbline.
latest news.title: Curbline Properties Publicly Files Form 10 with SEC By Investing.com

latest news.eng_title: ENFN Investors Have Opportunity to Join Enfusion, Inc. Securities Fraud Investigation with the Schall Law Firm
latest news.summary: The Schall Law Firm is investigating claims on behalf of Enfusion, Inc. investors for potential securities law violations. The investigation focuses on whether the Company issued false or misleading statements and/or failed to disclose information pertinent to investors. Enfusion missed consensus estimates for both earnings and revenue in its second-quarter 2024 financial results, causing shares to fall by 7.86% on August 6, 2024. If you are a shareholder who suffered a loss, you can contact Brian Schall of the Schall Law Firm to discuss your rights free of charge.
latest news.title: ENFN Investors Have Opportunity to Join Enfusion, Inc. Securities Fraud Investigation with the Schall Law Firm

latest news.eng_title: Navigating the SEC's 8-K Reporting Mandate: Cybersecurity Challenges & Compliance Realities
latest news.summary: The SEC's cybersecurity disclosure rules have been in effect for a year, but many organizations still have questions about compliance. Bill McLaughlin, president of Thrive, a managed services provider, explores some of the lingering issues. Companies must file a form 8-K within four business days after a cybersecurity event occurs, detailing the cause, resolution, and corporate impacts. The SEC recognizes that companies may not be able to determine materiality that quickly and notes that if there's not an unreasonable delay in reporting, there may be some leeway. Materiality is defined as any event that a reasonable person would consider important when making an investment decision, including operational, reputational, legal, and customer impact. Companies must submit a 10-K report every year to the SEC, while they file an 8-K form only after an incident has occurred. Both reports should err on the side of including more detail to fulfill requirements instead of withholding information. The SEC mandates that companies report each significant breach to assist investors in identifying potential pitfalls. If an incident occurs and is unreported but is later determined to be'material,' the four-day reporting clock begins then. The initial report provides an outline of the incident, and follow-up information will be filed, including incident response, resolution, impacts, etc. Incidents are reported in EDGAR, the SEC's electronic data gathering, analysis and retrieval system, regardless of resolution progress. The initial report and all updates carry the same board certification mandates as other SEC reports, putting an onus on the board to have cybersecurity understanding or skills.
latest news.title: Navigating the SEC's 8-K Reporting Mandate: Cybersecurity Challenges & Compliance Realities

latest news.eng_title: Saia Reports Strong Growth in LTL Shipments and Tonnage
latest news.summary: Saia, Inc. (NASDAQ:SAIA), leading logistics provider, reported an increase in LTL shipments and tonnage for the first two months of the third quarter of 2024. The company observed a 10.6% increase in LTL shipments and a 7.0% increase in tonnage in August 2024 compared to the same month last year. Despite this, LTL shipment weight decreased by 5.0% to 1,331 pounds in July 2024 from 1,401 pounds in July 2023. However, LTL shipment weight increased by 1.2% to 1,354 pounds in August 2024 from 1,339 pounds in August 2023. Saia's data release, strategic growth plans, and ongoing investments in its network are consistent with the company's performance. However, it is essential to note that the actual third quarter and annual results may differ significantly from the preliminary data due to various risk factors mentioned in the company's Form 10-K Annual Report and other filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The company has stated that the information provided is current as of the date of the press release and may change without notice. Saia, Inc. operates a wide range of LTL, non-LTL truckload, expedited, and logistics services and has 208 terminals in 47 states. This performance update is based on a press release statement and reflects the company's operational status while continuing to serve its customer base across the United States.
latest news.title: Saia, Q3'te LTL Sevkiyatlarında ve Tonajında Artış Bildiriyor Yazar Investing.com

latest news.eng_title: Investors in Vicor Corporation Should Contact Levi & Korsinsky Before September 23, 2024 to Discuss Your Rights
latest news.summary: Investors in Vicor Corporation who suffered losses between April 26, 2023 and February 22, 2024 may be eligible for a potential recovery under the federal securities laws. According to a class action lawsuit, Vicor's stock price fell approximately 60% after the company failed to disclose a significant deal for its H100 product, which was initially believed to be with Nvidia Corporation. The lawsuit alleges that Vicor's statements created a false impression, and the company's stock price has not recovered. If you suffered a loss in Vicor stock during this time frame, you can contact Levi & Korsinsky, a nationally-recognized securities litigation firm, to learn about your rights to seek a recovery. There is no cost or obligation to participate. 'Over the past 20 years, Levi & Korsinsky LLP has established itself as a nationally-recognized securities litigation firm that has secured hundreds of millions of dollars for aggrieved shareholders and built a track record of winning high-stakes cases,' said Ed Korsinsky, Esq. 'We have extensive expertise representing investors in complex securities litigation and a team of over 70 employees to serve our clients.'
latest news.title: Investors in Vicor Corporation Should Contact Levi & Korsinsky Before September 23, 2024 to Discuss Your Rights

latest news.eng_title: ORIGINAL: Descartes Announces Fiscal 2025 Second Quarter Financial Results
latest news.summary: Descartes Systems Group Inc. announced its financial results for the fiscal 2025 second quarter. The company reported record revenues of $163.4 million, up 14% from the same period last year. Income from operations was $45.9 million, up 25% from the same period last year. Net income was $34.7 million, up 23% from the same period last year. The company also reported a 12% increase in revenues for the six-month period ended July 31, 2024, to $314.8 million. Descartes' CEO, Edward J. Ryan, said, 'Our Global Logistics Network is designed to help shippers, carriers and logistics services providers navigate an increasingly complex global trade landscape.' The company's cash position increased by $13.8 million in the second quarter and decreased by $68.3 million in the six-month period. Descartes acquired BoxTop Technologies Limited, a leading provider of shipment management solutions, for approximately $12.1 million. The company filed a final short-form base shelf prospectus, allowing it to offer and issue an unlimited quantity of securities during the 25-month period following the filing.
latest news.title: ORIGINAL: Descartes Announces Fiscal 2025 Second Quarter Financial Results

latest news.eng_title: Glancy Prongay & Murray LLP Reminds Investors of Looming Deadline in the Class Action Lawsuit Against Methode Electronics, Inc. (MEI)
latest news.summary: Glancy Prongay & Murray LLP ('GPM') reminds investors of the upcoming October 25, 2024 deadline to file a lead plaintiff motion in the class action filed on behalf of investors who purchased or otherwise acquired Methode Electronics, Inc. ('Methode' or the 'Company') (NYSE: MEI) common stock between June 23, 2022 and March 6, 2024, inclusive (the 'Class Period'). The complaint alleges that throughout the Class Period, Defendants made materially false and/or misleading statements, as well as failed to disclose material adverse facts about the Company's business, operations, and prospects. Specifically, Defendants failed to disclose to investors that the Company had lost highly skilled and experienced employees, production planning deficiencies, inventory shortages, vendor and supplier problems, and logistical defects in its manufacturing systems. As a result, the Company's stock price fell significantly on several occasions, thereby injuring investors. If you suffered a loss on your Methode investments or would like to inquire about potentially pursuing claims to recover your loss under the federal securities laws, you can submit your contact information at www.glancylaw.com/cases/Methode-Electronics-Inc/. You can also contact Charles H. Linehan, of GPM at 310-201-9150, Toll-Free at 888-773-9224, or via email at shareholders@glancylaw.com to learn more about your rights.
latest news.title: Glancy Prongay & Murray LLP Reminds Investors of Looming Deadline in the Class Action Lawsuit Against Methode Electronics, Inc. (MEI)

latest news.eng_title: Declining Stock and Decent Financials: Is The Market Wrong About GXO Logistics, Inc. (NYSE:GXO)?
latest news.summary: GXO Logistics' (NYSE:GXO) stock has declined 3.3% over the past month, but its key financial indicators, such as Return on Equity (ROE), look decent. The company's ROE is 4.9%, which means it made $0.05 in profit for every $1 of shareholders' capital. Despite a low ROE, GXO Logistics has seen a 30% net income growth over the past five years, which is higher than the industry average of 14%. The company has been reinvesting all of its profits to grow its business, and analysts expect it to continue its recent growth streak.

latest news.eng_title: ROSEN, NATIONAL TRIAL LAWYERS, Encourages Vicor Corporation Investors to Secure Counsel Before Important Deadline in Securities Class Action
latest news.summary: Rosen Law Firm, a global investor rights law firm, reminds purchasers of Vicor Corporation common stock between April 26, 2023 and February 22, 2024, of the important September 23, 2024 lead plaintiff deadline in a securities class action lawsuit. According to the lawsuit, defendants created a false impression that Vicor had secured a significant deal for its H100 product, which proved incorrect when the Company failed to discuss the deal and later announced a sharp reversal in new contracts and sales. Investors who purchased Vicor common stock during the Class Period may be entitled to compensation without payment of any out of pocket fees or costs through a contingency fee arrangement. To join the Vicor class action, go to https://rosenlegal.com/submit-form/?case_id=27447 or call Phillip Kim, Esq. toll-free at 866-767-3653 or email [email protected] for information on the class action. Rosen Law Firm has a track record of success in leadership roles and has recovered hundreds of millions of dollars for investors.
latest news.title: ROSEN, NATIONAL TRIAL LAWYERS, Encourages Vicor Corporation Investors to Secure Counsel Before Important Deadline in Securities Class Action

news knowledge.eng_title: What Late SEC Filers Need To Know In 2024
news knowledge.summary: Companies that fail to file their SEC reports on time may face severe consequences, including delisting from stock exchanges, trading halts, and potential revocation of their registration under the Exchange Act. The SEC requires companies to file annual and quarterly reports on Forms 10-K and 10-Q, respectively, within specific deadlines. If a company misses a deadline, it must file a Form 12b-25 within one business day, disclosing its inability to file the report timely and the reason for the delay. The company then has 15 calendar days to file the required report, or 30 calendar days for a Form 10-K or 20-F. Failure to file the report within the extended time period may result in delisting. Companies listed on the NYSE or NASDAQ must also issue a press release announcing the failure to file timely a periodic report with the SEC. The SEC may suspend trading in the company's securities for up to 10 trading days or institute an administrative proceeding against the late filer. Companies that have previously relied on Form S-3 or Form F-3 for shelf registrations and have become ineligible to utilize these forms due to late filings may not be able to file a new registration statement for at least 12 months from the original filing due date. The SEC provides exceptions for certain Form 8-K disclosure items, but failure to file timely under other items will result in a loss of Form S-3 eligibility.
news knowledge.title: What Late SEC Filers Need To Know In 2024

news knowledge.eng_title: Trimble to Update and Reconvene 2024 Annual Meeting
news knowledge.summary: Trimble Inc. has announced that it will update and reconvene its 2024 annual meeting due to delays in filing the revised annual report. The original report was filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on February 26, 2024. The company has undergone an in-depth review by Ernst & Young LLP (EY), which is expected to be completed within the next month. According to Trimble's management, no errors have been found that would require a re-determination of the consolidated financial statements, and EY has not withdrawn the audit report included in the original Form 10-K. Due to the imminent completion of the review procedures, Trimble intends to update its annual meeting scheduled for August 14, 2024, and reconvene it on September 30, 2024, at 10:00 AM (Mountain Time), via remote communication. The company expects to file the revised Form 10-K with the SEC by that date. Registered shareholders as of April 1, 2024, can vote at the reconvened annual meeting. Proxies already submitted will be valid for the new meeting date unless revoked. Shareholders who have voted do not need to take further action unless they wish to change their vote. Those who wish to change their vote can do so online or by phone until 11:59 PM (Eastern Time) on September 29, 2024, or virtually during the meeting.
news knowledge.title: Trimble riconvocherà l'assemblea annuale del 2024 dopo il completamento della revisione contabile Da Investing.com

news knowledge.eng_title: Greystone Housing Impact Investors LP : Supplemental Financial Report for the Quarter Ended June 30, 2024 Form 8 K
news knowledge.summary: Greystone Housing Impact Investors LP declared five supplemental distributions in 2023 and 2024, totaling $0.07 per BUC each. The distributions were paid at a ratio of 0.00418 to 0.00448 BUCs for each issued and outstanding BUC, based on the closing price of the BUCs on the NYSE. The distributions were completed on January 31, 2023, July 31, 2023, October 31, 2023, January 31, 2024, and April 30, 2024. No fractional BUCs were issued, and all fractional BUCs received cash based on the market value of the BUCs on the record date. The distributions have been applied retroactively to all net income per BUC, distributions per BUC, and similar per BUC disclosures for all periods indicated in this supplemental financial report.
news knowledge.title: Greystone Housing Impact Investors LP : Supplemental Financial Report for the Quarter Ended June 30, 2024 Form 8 K

news knowledge.eng_title: Cape Investment Advisory Inc. Raises Stock Holdings in Greystone Housing Impact Investors LP (NYSE:GHI)
news knowledge.summary: Cape Investment Advisory Inc. increased its stake in Greystone Housing Impact Investors LP (NYSE:GHI) by 60.5% during the first quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The institutional investor owned 8,105 shares of the company's stock after purchasing an additional 3,056 shares during the quarter. Several other hedge funds have also bought and sold shares of GHI, including Tucker Asset Management LLC, Pineridge Advisors LLC, Cetera Advisors LLC, Tradition Wealth Management LLC, and PFG Investments LLC. As of its most recent filing with the SEC, Cape Investment Advisory Inc.'s holdings in Greystone Housing Impact Investors were worth $132,000. The company's stock traded down 0.3% on Friday, reaching $14.33, and has a market cap of $333.75 million. Greystone Housing Impact Investors LP has a 12-month low of $14.25 and a 12-month high of $17.55.
news knowledge.title: Cape Investment Advisory Inc. Raises Stock Holdings in Greystone Housing Impact Investors LP (NYSE:GHI)

news knowledge.eng_title: PowerFleet : FORM 12b-25 NOTIFICATION OF LATE FILING
news knowledge.summary: Powerfleet, Inc. has filed a notification with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) stating that it will not be able to file its Transition Report on Form 10-K for the transition period from January 1, 2024 to March 31, 2024 by the original due date of July 22, 2024. The company expects to file the report within the 15-day extension period provided under Rule 12b-25 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The delay is due to additional time required to complete the financial statement close process, including compiling and reviewing information related to the company's business combination with MiX Telematics Ltd.
news knowledge.title: PowerFleet : FORM 12b-25 NOTIFICATION OF LATE FILING

news knowledge.eng_title: NextTrip, Inc. Receives Nasdaq Notification Regarding Late 10-Q Filing and Continued Listing Requirements
news knowledge.summary: NextTrip, Inc. (NASDAQ:NTRP) has received a notification from Nasdaq due to its failure to timely file its Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended February 29, 2024 and its Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the fiscal quarter ended May 31, 2024. The company has until August 16, 2024, to either file its delinquent reports with the SEC or submit a plan to regain compliance with Nasdaq Listing Rule 5250(c)(1). If the company does not regain compliance, its common stock may be subject to delisting. The company intends to file the delinquent reports or submit a plan to regain compliance by the deadline.
news knowledge.title: NextTrip, Inc. Receives Nasdaq Notification Regarding Late 10-Q Filing and Continued Listing Requirements
